review_title: Great place to work if you dont need to make alot of $$$

review_title: The people at RVNA really care about the patients and the staff. Best VNA that I have worked for by far.
job_title: Registered Nurse Home Care in Kingston, NH
pros:
Caring staff
Good pay
They really try to help you balance work and life schedule. 
Area that you cover is not too large.
cons: Weekends need more nurses or they need to stop taking as many admits as we do. This way all patients get seen and the nurses don't always have to work more than 8 hrs on the weekends. We work 1 weekend every 4 weeks

pros: Easy to get time off when needed. Wonderful direct mngr. Awesome cafeteria. Great health benefits.
cons: Some HR nurse recruiters can be difficult to deal with.  EH has lower pay scale than surrounding hospitals. HR takes so long to get back to potential employees they end up losing them. (heard this from many RN applicants over the years)

pros: Work with great, committed staff who appreciate each other and care deeply for the patients in our community. Co-workers encourage and recognize each other for their initiative.
cons: Bloated highly compensated administrators are out of touch with overworked employees. Unreasonable expectations are set with rigid top-down management style. There is tremendous turnover in practice management.

review_title: Great coworkers and unlike the for profit hospitals in the area, they really put patients first here
pros: Patients really do come first and it isn't like that at others in the area. Coworkers are so nice and people are just happy there. Good medical benefits. Management really works to develop their staff and want them to succeed.
cons: Less holidays , they are taken from PTO should be separate, and pay is most areas is a bit lower than similar jobs in the area.

pros: The culture here is friendly, people step up and are team players and the benefits are fantastic. You don't see a benefits package like this from many employers anymore. They are flexible and understanding and take their employees seriously. I would highly recommend Exeter Hospital as a place to work.
cons: I wish they offered on site daycare

pros: A top notch organization with the Patient as the main focus of every decision and action.  Ethical leadership, respectful work environment, high quality staff, extremely clean facility, collaborative culture.
cons: There can be variance between managers -  styles and effectiveness - but that would exist in any company.

review_title: Disjointed care leads to unsafe practice
pros: The benefits package is hard to beat. While the pay isn't great by any means the benefits make up for it.
cons: Lack of communication between providers and nursing staff leads to dangerous patient care. Additionally the management is so focused on customer service that it forgets what it takes to provide reasonable patient care.

pros: Nice building, nice coworkers, staff parking garage, free parking, close to highway, nice equipment, units well stocked, great cafe, hospitalist service.
cons: Low pay, does not follow Magnet-RNs not listened to, non caring middle and upper management, cafe not open for last part of evening shift and overnight shift.

review_title: Horrible work conditions. Unhealthy treatment of employees.
pros:
Location-Beautiful area.
Easy parking. The benefits package is not bad, but need to get care from Exeter Hospital physicians. Some OK, but others, particularly surgeons, seem incompetent.
cons:
Surgeons very poor, from what the OR nurses tell us.
Administration, in my opinion, totally against nurses and other patient care individuals
Care only about cutting costs and making more money
